ITEM.name: Geometric Modeler Objects, Model Size and Tolerances
The Objects of CATIA Geometric Modeler: Overview
ITEM.text: is an introduction to GM objects.

ITEM.name: The Curves of CATIA Geometric Modeler
ITEM.text: describes the properties and the particular features of the CGM curves.

ITEM.name: The Surfaces of CATIA Geometric Modeler
ITEM.text: describes the properties and the particular features of the CGM surfaces.

ITEM.name: About NURBS
ITEM.text: defines the concepts and the CGM implementation of NURBS.

ITEM.name: The Management of Tolerances
ITEM.text: describes how to manage gaps between the geometry onto which the topology relies.

ITEM.name: About the Model Size and Infinite
ITEM.text: describes the parameters driving the model validity in terms of dimensions.

ITEM.name: An Introduction to Geometric Modeler Use Cases
List of GMModel Use Case Modules
Foreign Mathematical Functions
ITEM.text: is an example of creating your own geometric object with its associated mathematical functions.

ITEM.name: The Management of Foreign Data
ITEM.text: describes how to put foreign data on CGM objects or create own your geometric curves or surfaces.

ITEM.name: Creating Foreign Surfaces
ITEM.text: is an example of creating your own kind of surface.

ITEM.name: Topology Concepts
ITEM.text: introduces the CGM topology objects, and the manifold and non-manifold topologies.

ITEM.name: The CGM Topological Model
ITEM.text: describes how the topology concepts are implemented.

ITEM.name: How to Associate Topology with Geometry
ITEM.text: defines the rules that exist between topological and geometric objects.

ITEM.name: Using the Topological Objects
ITEM.text: is an example showing creating and navigating the topological objects using a tetrahedron.

ITEM.name: Scanning an Edge Curve
ITEM.text: is an example showing how to use the CATEdgeCurveIterator operator.

ITEM.name: Creating or Computing an Edge Curve
ITEM.text: is an example showing how to use the CATICGMEdgeCurveComputation operator.

ITEM.name: About Geometric Modeler Use Cases
ITEM.text: describes the code parts that are common to the Geometric Modeler use cases.

ITEM.name: How to Use the Geometric Operators
ITEM.text: describes how to create and use geometric operators in both the BASIC and the ADVANCED modes.

ITEM.name: Creating Explicit Objects
ITEM.text: is an example of using the explicit object factory.

ITEM.name: Creating Implicit Objects
ITEM.text: is an example of using the implicit object factory.

ITEM.name: Creating and Transforming Geometry
ITEM.text: is an example of creating geometric objects and using the clone and transformation managers.

ITEM.name: Creating a Topological Point on a Wire
ITEM.text: explains how to create a topological point on a wire at a given curvilinear distance from a given vertex.

ITEM.name: Computing a Mathematical Point on a Wire
ITEM.text: explains how to create a point at a given ratio from an end of a wire.

ITEM.name: Computing the Minimum Distance between Geometries
The Clone and Transformation Managers
ITEM.text: describes how to duplicate and/or move CGM objects.

ITEM.name: Using the Smart Duplicator
ITEM.text: explains how to modify a touched topology.

ITEM.name: Using NURBS
ITEM.text: is an example of creating various kinds of NURBS curves.

ITEM.name: Breaking a C1 Nurbs Curve into C2 Pieces
Breaking a C1 Nurbs Surface into C2 Pieces
Creating an Attribute
ITEM.text: is an example of finding an attribute from a geometric object and reading the attribute value.

ITEM.name: Reading an Attribute
ITEM.text: is an example of creating, setting a value to, and assigning an attribute to geometric objects.

ITEM.name: Intersecting a Curve with a Surface
ITEM.text: is an example of using a geometric operator.

ITEM.name: Intersecting Curves
ITEM.text: is an example of using a geometric operator.

ITEM.name: Intersecting a Curve with a Surface
ITEM.text: is an example of using a geometric operator.

ITEM.name: Intersecting Surfaces
ITEM.text: is an example of using a geometric operator.

ITEM.name: Projecting a Point onto a Curve
ITEM.text: is an example of using a geometric operator.

ITEM.name: Projecting a Point onto a Surface
ITEM.text: is an example of using a geometric operator.

ITEM.name: Projecting a Curve onto a Surface
ITEM.text: is an example of using a geometric operator.

ITEM.name: Creating a Composite Law
ITEM.text: is an example of using a CATGeoFactory service.

ITEM.name: Analyzing the Parameters of a Point on a Curve
ITEM.text: is an example of using the CATICGMAnalysisLocal1D operator.

ITEM.name: Analyzing the Parameters of a Point on a Surface
ITEM.text: is an example of using the CATICGMAnalysisLocal2D operator.

ITEM.name: Checking the Confusion of Points on a Curve
ITEM.text: is an example of using the CATICGMConfusionPtOnCrvPtOnCrv operator.

ITEM.name: Checking the Confusion of Points on a Surface
ITEM.text: is an example of using the CATICGMConfusionPtOnSurPtOnSur operator.

ITEM.name: Extracting the Canonical Representation of a Curve
Testing the Position of a Point Inside a Face or a Volume
Using a Tessellation Operator
ITEM.text: is an example of creating a topological body and tessellate this body using a using a tessellation operator.

ITEM.name: Browsing the Geometric Container
ITEM.text: is an example of creating a geometric container and an application to display its contents.

ITEM.name: How to Use MProc to Tessellate a Multi-Body Model
